00043 class KVIRC_API KviKvsExtendedRunTimeData
00044 {
00045         friend class KviKvsRunTimeContext;
00046 protected:
00047         KviKvsHash       * m_pExtendedScopeVariables; // extended scope vars, shallow, may be 0
00048         KviKvsSwitchList * m_pAliasSwitchList;        // switches for the aliases, shallow, may be 0
00049         KviKvsObject     * m_pThisObject;             // the current object for object function calls
00050         QString          * m_pScriptFilePath;         // the current script file path, shallow, may be 0
00051         bool               m_bAutoDelete;
00052         QString          * m_pPopupId;
00053 public:
00054         // all shallow data, all may be 0
00055         KviKvsExtendedRunTimeData()
00056                 : m_pExtendedScopeVariables(0),
00057                 m_pAliasSwitchList(0),
00058                 m_pThisObject(0),
00059                 m_pScriptFilePath(0),
00060                 m_bAutoDelete(FALSE),
00061                 m_pPopupId(0)
00062                 {};
00063         KviKvsExtendedRunTimeData(KviKvsHash * pExtScopeVariables,bool autoDelete=FALSE)
00064                 : m_pExtendedScopeVariables(pExtScopeVariables),
00065                 m_pAliasSwitchList(0),
00066                 m_pThisObject(0),
00067                 m_pScriptFilePath(0),
00068                 m_bAutoDelete(autoDelete),
00069                 m_pPopupId(0)
00070                 {};
00071         KviKvsExtendedRunTimeData(KviKvsSwitchList * pAliasSwitchList,bool autoDelete=FALSE)
00072                 : m_pExtendedScopeVariables(0),
00073                 m_pAliasSwitchList(pAliasSwitchList),
00074                 m_pThisObject(0),
00075                 m_pScriptFilePath(0),
00076                 m_bAutoDelete(autoDelete),
00077                 m_pPopupId(0)
00078                 {};
00079         KviKvsExtendedRunTimeData(KviKvsObject * pThisObject,bool autoDelete=FALSE)
00080                 : m_pExtendedScopeVariables(0),
00081                 m_pAliasSwitchList(0),
00082                 m_pThisObject(pThisObject),
00083                 m_pScriptFilePath(0),
00084                 m_bAutoDelete(autoDelete),
00085                 m_pPopupId(0)
00086                 {};
00087         KviKvsExtendedRunTimeData(QString * pScriptFilePath,bool autoDelete=FALSE)
00088                 : m_pExtendedScopeVariables(0),
00089                 m_pAliasSwitchList(0),
00090                 m_pThisObject(0),
00091                 m_pScriptFilePath(pScriptFilePath),
00092                 m_bAutoDelete(autoDelete),
00093                 m_pPopupId(0)
00094                 {};
00095         ~KviKvsExtendedRunTimeData();
00096 public:
00097         KviKvsHash * extendedScopeVariables(){ return m_pExtendedScopeVariables; };
00098         KviKvsSwitchList * aliasSwitchList(){ return m_pAliasSwitchList; };
00099         KviKvsObject * thisObject(){ return m_pThisObject; };
00100         QString * scriptFilePath(){ return m_pScriptFilePath; };
00101         QString * popupId(){ return m_pPopupId; };
00102         void setPopupId(QString * pPopupId);
00103 };

00106 class KVIRC_API KviKvsRunTimeContext
00107 {
00108         friend class KviKvsScript;
00109         friend class KviKvsObject;
00110         friend class KviKvsRunTimeCall;
00111         friend class KviKvsEventManager;
00112 protected:
00113         // only KviKvsScript, KviKvsEventManager and KviKvsObject can instantiate this class
00114         KviKvsRunTimeContext(KviKvsScript * pScript,
00115                                 KviWindow * pWnd,
00116                                 KviKvsVariantList * pParams,
00117                                 KviKvsVariant * pRetVal,
00118                                 KviKvsExtendedRunTimeData * pExtData = 0);
00119 public:
00120         ~KviKvsRunTimeContext();
00121 protected:
00122         // stuff that is fixed in the whole script context
00123         KviKvsScript              * m_pScript;                  // shallow, may be 0!
00124         KviKvsHash                * m_pLocalVariables;          // owned, never 0
00125         KviKvsVariantList         * m_pParameterList;           // shallow, never 0
00126         KviKvsVariant             * m_pReturnValue;             // shallow, never 0
00127 
00128         // stuff that is generally global but sometimes may change
00129         // during the execution of the script
00130         KviWindow                 * m_pWindow;                  // shallow, never 0
00131 
00132         enum RunTimeFlags { BreakPending = 1, ContinuePending = 2, HaltCalled = 4, DisableReporting = 8 };
00133         unsigned int                m_uRunTimeFlags;            // a combination of RunTimeFlags
00134 
00135         KviKvsExtendedRunTimeData * m_pExtendedData;            // shallow, may be 0
00136 
00137         // error handling
00138         bool                        m_bError;                   // was error() ever called ?
00139         KviKvsTreeNode            * m_pDefaultReportLocation;   // default report location for error()
00140 public:
00141         // the window that this script is bound to (it MAY change during the script parsing)
00142         KviWindow * window()
00143                 { return m_pWindow; };
00144         // quick access to the irc context (it MAY be zero!)
00145         KviIrcContext * context()
00146                 { return m_pWindow->context(); };
00147         // quick access to the console that this script is bound to (it MAY be zero, if there is no console)
00148         KviConsoleWindow * console()
00149                 { return m_pWindow->console(); };
00150         // quick access to the connection: it MAY be zero!
00151         KviIrcConnection * connection()
00152                 { return m_pWindow->connection(); };
00153 
00154         // the local variables of this script
00155         KviKvsHash * localVariables()
00156                 { return m_pLocalVariables; };
00157         // the global application-wide variables
00158         KviKvsHash * globalVariables();
00159         // the parameters passed to this script
00160         KviKvsVariantList * parameterList()
00161                 { return m_pParameterList; };
00162 
00163         // parent script, may be 0!
00164         KviKvsScript * script()
00165                 { return m_pScript; };
00166 
00167         KviKvsVariant * returnValue()
00168                 { return m_pReturnValue; };
00169 
00170         // this is the default error reporting location
00171         // it is also used by rfc2812wrapper to find out the current command name!
00172         KviKvsTreeNode * defaultReportLocation()
00173                 { return m_pDefaultReportLocation; };
00174 
00175         // the extended stuff
00176         KviKvsHash * extendedScopeVariables()
00177                 { return m_pExtendedData ? m_pExtendedData->extendedScopeVariables() : 0; };
00178         KviKvsSwitchList * aliasSwitchList()
00179                 { return m_pExtendedData ? m_pExtendedData->aliasSwitchList() : 0; };
00180         KviKvsObject * thisObject()
00181                 { return m_pExtendedData ? m_pExtendedData->thisObject() : 0; };
00182         QString * scriptFilePath()
00183                 { return m_pExtendedData ? m_pExtendedData->scriptFilePath() : 0; };
00184         QString * popupId()
00185                 { return m_pExtendedData ? m_pExtendedData->popupId() : 0; };
00186 
00187         // this MUST be called before any blocking call that might return to the main event loop
00188         // and eventually quit kvirc or close the window that this command is associated to
00189         // Actually this is a NO-OP but later may really do something that avoids kvirc to crash
00190         void enterBlockingSection();
00191         // this MUST be called after exiting the blocking section above
00192         // if this function returns false your parsing code MUST "return false" immediately:
00193         // it means that something rather critical happened and the script
00194         // execution cannot continue
00195         bool leaveBlockingSection();
00196 
00197         // Error handling
00198 
00199         // was error(...) ever called ?
00200         bool error() const { return m_bError; };
00201 
00202         void error(KviKvsTreeNode * pNode,const QString &szMsgFmt,...);
00203         void warning(KviKvsTreeNode * pNode,const QString &szMsgFmt,...);
00204         void error(const QString &szMsgFmt,...);
00205         void warning(const QString &szMsgFmt,...);
00206         void setDefaultReportLocation(KviKvsTreeNode * pNode);
00207         bool errorNoIrcContext();
00208         bool warningNoIrcConnection();
00209         bool warningMissingParameter();
00210 
00211 //PRIVATE:
00212         // tricky
00213         // don't use it: it's only for the parser
00214         void setWindow(KviWindow * pWnd)
00215                 { m_pWindow = pWnd; };
00216 
00217         // returns the old pointer
00218         KviKvsVariant * swapReturnValuePointer(KviKvsVariant * pNewPointer);
00219         // the old pointer MUST be reset!
00220 
00221         // this is called by the parser when a break is encountered
00222         // the parser calls setBreakPending() and returns false
00223         // the contexts that can handle a break should check breakPending()
00224         // after an internal evaluation returned false.
00225         // if breakPending() they should handle it with handleBreak() and
00226         // return true instead.
00227         void setBreakPending()
00228                 { m_uRunTimeFlags |= BreakPending; };
00229         // this tells if a break command has been called
00230         // it may return true if an execution() command has returned false
00231         // (if breakPending() there should be no error()
00232         bool breakPending()
00233                 { return (m_uRunTimeFlags & BreakPending); };
00234         // this is called by the commands that can handle a break
00235         void handleBreak()
00236                 { m_uRunTimeFlags &= ~BreakPending; };
00237 
00238         // this is called by the parser when a continue is encountered
00239         void setContinuePending()
00240                 { m_uRunTimeFlags |= ContinuePending; };
00241         // this tells if a continue command has been called
00242         bool continuePending()
00243                 { return (m_uRunTimeFlags & ContinuePending); };
00244         // this is called by the commands that can handle a continue
00245         void handleContinue()
00246                 { m_uRunTimeFlags &= ~ContinuePending; };
00247 
00248         // this is called by the parser when a halt is encountered
00249         // the parser then returns false and all the stack frames
00250         // above should do the same
00251         void setHaltCalled()
00252                 { m_uRunTimeFlags |= HaltCalled; };
00253         bool haltCalled()
00254                 { return (m_uRunTimeFlags & HaltCalled); };
00255 
00256         // this is used by KviKvsScript to disable reporting when the Quiet flag is used
00257         void disableReporting()
00258                 { m_uRunTimeFlags |= DisableReporting; };
00259         bool reportingDisabled()
00260                 { return (m_uRunTimeFlags & DisableReporting); };
00261         void enableReporting()
00262                 { m_uRunTimeFlags &= ~DisableReporting; };
00263 
00264         // clears the error status on this context
00265         // this is useful to continue execution after an error
00266         // and probably used only in /eval
00267         void clearError()
00268                 { m_bError = false; };
00269         protected:
00270 
00271         void report(bool bError,KviKvsTreeNode * pNode,const QString &szMsgFmt,kvi_va_list va);
00272 
00273 };
00274 
00275 #endif //!_KVI_KVS_RUNTIMECONTEXT_H_
